file_content.text: Imperial traffic's picked up. Most of their forces have left Voss. Whatever you did, it worked.
The sooner you help us, the sooner we can stop tolerating the Empire.
Hold up a minute. Commander Hurada, station security. Glad I caught you before the shuttle.
I have an urgent message from Ambassador Jannik, our envoy on Voss. I'll patch him through now.
I'm sure you all have important business, so let me say up front that my request won't interfere. It might even help.
Master Jedi. I'm well aware of the order's stance on Voss, but the situation is getting desperate.
It's an honor, Major. I know the stories behind most of your operations. I hope you're brave enough for a little diplomacy.
I'm sorry to detain you. But as the hero of the Esseles, you represent the Republic.
Negotiations with the Voss have stalled, and I'm looking for high-profile help. Are you familiar with the planet?
I'm interested in an ambassador's take.
I'd like to learn more.
Ambassador, soldier, Jedi, civilian--we're all outsiders to the Voss.
Not really.
The Voss are the planet's only civilized race. We made contact with them a few years ago.
They have little knowledge of the greater galaxy and only recently obtained spaceflight from us, but they're not primitive.
Just give me the basics.
The Republic's only had contact with the Voss for a matter of years. It's a short history.
Their society revolves around the Mystics, Force users who have visions of the future. Those visions guide every decision the Voss make, and the Voss believe they're never wrong.
Is that all the Mystics can do? See the future?
Are they all visionaries?
Mystics can also become gifted healers.
Untrained Force users can be dangerous.
That's an awful lot of power.
The order tells me the Mystics are gray, as close to the Sith as the Jedi. I'm hoping you're more open-minded.
We could win this war a lot sooner if we knew how they pull that off.
Wish we could do that.
Imagine how the Sacking of Coruscant would have turned out if we'd seen it coming.
So their planet's run by a bunch of fortune-tellers.
Seems pretty naive to me.
Those fortune-tellers have guided the Voss safely throughout their history.
The Voss only do what their visions tell them?
How does that work?
The Mystics see what's coming and declare what the Voss should do to achieve it--or avoid it.
I don't need a history lesson.
A Republic alliance with the Voss could be key to winning this war. Unfortunately, the Empire has the same idea.
So far, the Voss have refused to take sides, and they've established rigid neutrality laws to keep us in line.
If Republic lives are at stake, don't expect me to stand aside.
I protect people, not laws.
Don't the Voss care about the Empire's crimes?
How can they be neutral?
Our problems don't affect the Voss. And frankly, I think they're tired of hearing about them.
If the Empire attacks, we have to defend ourselves.
Laws won't stop the Empire.
We let the Empire provoke us, and we lose our chances with the Voss.
You stick a blaster in my face and all bets are off.
I don't back off from a fight.
That's exactly the kind of trigger-happy attitude we don't need. There's too much at stake.
The Voss have to protect themselves.
I can understand that.
Good. I spend too much time defending Republic citizens who get into scrapes with Imperials.
The Republic doesn't need Imperial sympathizers.
We're fine without them.
This war can't end with another treaty. Either the Republic wins, or it dies.
We need to show the Voss that the Empire only acts respectful because of the Mystics.
I'm doing everything I can to expose them, but the Voss don't seem to hear me anymore. A fresh face might help.
I'm willing to represent the order.
A Jedi might have better luck.
The Jedi are the closest we have to a Mystic. It can't hurt.
I'd like to learn more about the Voss.
You've piqued my interest.
Glad to hear it. Most Jedi treat the Voss like the second coming of the Sith.
Recruiting's not my specialty, but I can talk up the Republic.
I'll do whatever it takes.
Another voice would be a great help.
I'm no diplomat, but I'll stand around and look pretty if you want.
A face like mine, definitely.
It might get a little more involved than that....
That seems easy enough.
I'm staying at a Voss survey outpost, keeping an eye on the Empire. Commander Hurada can handle the details of getting here.
Not much to arrange. Shuttle will take you to Voss-Ka, their capital city. Local transport can get you to the survey outpost.
Remember--the Voss keep all outsiders confined to the Alien Enclave, regardless of affiliation. Someone makes trouble, ignore them.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
The Mystics could be dangerous, we need to learn more about Voss... the Jedi always have an excuse.
Fine. But if you get into trouble on Voss, don't expect me to defend you.
Make sure you've been briefed on Voss before shuttling down. We don't need another incident.
